intro: Pimpinella zagrosica, commonly known as the Zagros cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Zagros Mountains in Iran. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in rocky and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its slender stems and small, compound leaves are characteristic of the genus Pimpinella. The flowers, which are white or pale yellow, appear in umbels and attract various pollinators.
